Articles.Content:
I suggest the possibility to create online contracts. So i can create a contract to public, or only my friends. So, if i need fuel, i can create a contract, specifying what i need, the money i'll pay, the deadline, the penalty, etc. Once the other player fulfilled the contract, he would get the money, and i would get the fuel, simple as that. This is only a example, but it could be implemented for rescue kerbals, add space station parts, pay for science, fuel, repairs, exploring other bodies, etc. If the player who get the contract, by any means could not fulfill the contract, the money penalty would revert to the player that created the contract.

So i ask:

-It has already been suggested?

-Is there a mod with this suggestion?

-Is it possible?

This is a great idea for if (when?) multiplayer gets added.

Kind of a nice way to hook things together.

That is actually an amazing idea for when multiplayer arrives.

Kind of how GTA V bounties work, except you would create a chain of different events that needed completing by someone else.

Even better than a contract with a fixed price....bid it out. See who can get it done for the cheapest cost. Adds a bonus to you for contracting it out, and an added challenge for the person accepting the contract.

How it would all work and how it would keep griefers from having fun remains to be seen.
Agree, this would be a very good idea for Multiplayer.
